title: FD-TRANSFER: Research file descriptor transfer mechanisms
description:
Investigate how to implement file descriptor transfer in Rust:

- Research the `sendfd` crate capabilities and API
- Understand Unix domain socket ancillary data for fd passing
- Learn Rust patterns for sending/receiving multiple descriptors
- Study descriptor lifecycle management
- Investigate error handling for fd transfer failures

Goal: Understand complete fd transfer flow from client to daemon.

title: prefork-democli: Build pre-fork daemon and client system
description:
A client/server pre-fork system for Rust:
- `pfd` (daemon): Receives execution contexts and file descriptors, runs commands
- `pfc` (client): Transfers execution context to daemon and terminates

Execution context includes: command, args, cwd, and file descriptors (stdin/stdout/stderr)

Key features:
- File descriptor transfer via Unix domain sockets
- Multiple discovery strategies (local, XDG, XDG-project)
- Auto-launch daemon on demand
- Minimal client footprint
